intro: Trachyspermum copticum, commonly known as cumin, is an annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and feathery, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and oval, seed-containing fruits. Its seeds are widely used as a spice and are valued for their distinctive flavor and essential oils. Trachyspermum copticum thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular crop in temperate climates.
